content: प्रवृत्तिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} {@--1@} Continued advance. {@--2@} Rise, origin, source, flow (of words &c.); प्रवृत्तिरासीच्छब्दानां चरितार्था चतुष्टयी <ls>Ku. 2. 17.</ls> {@--3@} Appearance, manifestation; कुसुमप्रवृत्तिसमये <ls>Ś. 4. 17</ls> {%<ab>v. l.</ab>%}; <ls>R. 11. 43</ls>; <ls n="R.">14. 39</ls>; <ls n="R.">15. 4.</ls> {@--4@} Advent, setting in, commencement; आकालिकीं वीक्ष्य मधुप्रवृत्तिं <ls>Ku. 3. 34.</ls> {@--5@} Application or addiction to, tendency, inclination, predilection, propensity; सतां हि स देहपदेषु वस्तषु प्रमाणमंतः करणप्रवृत्तयः <ls>Ś. 1. 22.</ls> {@--6@} Conduct; behaviour; <ls>R. 14. 73.</ls> {@--7@} Employment, occupation, activity; <ls>Ku. 6. 26.</ls> {@--8@} Use, employment, currency (as of a word). {@--9@} Continued effort, perseverance. {@--10@} Signification, sense, acceptation (of a word). {@--11@} Continuance, permanence, prevalence. {@--12@} Active life, taking an active part in worldly affairs (<ab>opp.</ab> निवृत्ति). {@--13@} News, tidings, intelligence; जीमूतेन स्वकुशलमयीं हारयिष्यन् प्रवृत्तिं <ls>Me. 4</ls>; <ls>V. 4. 20.</ls> {@--14@} Applicability or validity of a rule. {@--15@} Fate, destiny, luck. {@--16@} Cognition, direct perception or apprehension. {@--17@} Rutting juice, or ichor exuding from the temples of an elephant in rut. {@--18@} <ab>N.</ab> of the city of उज्जयिनी <ab>q. v.</ab>
